| History                 = Political, military, and religious organization fighting for the establishment of an [[Wikipedia:Caliphate|Islamic caliphate]] in the [[Middle East]], particularly in the [[Wikipedia:Levant|Levant]], which includes parts of modern day [[Cyprus]], [[Israel]], [[Iraq]], [[Jordan]], [[Lebanon]], [[Palestine]], [[Syria]], and [[Turkey]].

When [[Vernon Fury (Earth-616)|Scorpio]] and the [[Zodiac (Jacobs') (Earth-616)|Zodiac]] used the [[Zodiac Key]] to open the [[Zodiac Vault]] at the [[Greenwich]] [[Royal Observatory]], those in [[London (England)|London]] speculated that the brilliant flash and subsequent lights in the sky were an ISIS attack.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 11}}

After [[Ezra Keith (Earth-616)|Ezra Keith]] became the fourth person to die in [[City of New York Department of Correction (Earth-616)|NYDOC]] custody in a single summer, protests began in [[Harlem]] and [[Warren Wilhelm, Jr. (Earth-616)|Mayor Bill de Blasio]] ordered a curfew and deployed both the [[New York City Police Department (Earth-616)|NYPD]], as well as the [[Americops (Earth-616)|Americops]], robotic law enforcement officers developed by a private security contractor, [[Keane Industries (Earth-616)|Keane Industries]], a crackdown which [[Mercedes Knight (Earth-616)|Misty Knight]] mused was more appropriate for ISIS than [[New York City]].{{r|Black Panther & the Crew Vol 1 1}}

As the [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]] later rescued Mayor de Blasio from the [[Brotherhood of Evil Mutants (Earth-616)|Brotherhood of Evil Mutants]], [[Santo Vaccarro (Earth-616)|Rockslide]] noted that the room where he was being held reminded him of the setup for ISIS hostage videos.{{r|X-Men: Gold Vol 2 3}}
